text: Camilo José Cela y Trulock, 1st Marquis of Iria Flavia (; 11 May 1916 – 17 January 2002) was a Spanish novelist, short story writer and essayist. He worked with the Generation of '36 movement. He was awarded the 1989 Nobel Prize in Literature "for a rich and intensive prose, which with restrained compassion forms a challenging vision of man's vulnerability". Cela died in Madrid, Spain from heart disease, aged 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * Camilo José Cela Foundation * * BBC obituary * Biography of Camilo José Cela * Photos * The Nobel Foundation has a site on him, including speeches, biography and bibliography. * Genealogy of Cela Family Category:1916 births Category:2002 deaths Category:Spanish novelists Category:Spanish Nobel Prize winners Category:Miguel de Cervantes Prize winners
title: Camilo José Cela
